intro: Hippolytia kaschgarica, commonly known as the Kaschgarica sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
